meanings.definition: To dismiss from employment or service.
meanings.sent1: The manager disemploys the employee for being late every day.
meanings.sent2: She disemploys the old computer and replaces it with a new one.
meanings.sent3: The robot disemploys the malfunctioning worker and hires a new one.
meanings.sent4: The broom disemploys the dust from the floor with each sweep.
meanings.sent5: The teacher disemploys the disruptive student to maintain a peaceful classroom.

meanings.definition: To remove from use or operation.
meanings.sent1: The company disemploys the outdated machinery to make room for new equipment.
meanings.sent2: He disemploys the broken toy and throws it away.
meanings.sent3: The magician disemploys the old trick and amazes the audience with a new one.
meanings.sent4: Time disemploys the memories of the past, making way for new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The chef disemploys the dull knife and sharpens it to continue cooking efficiently.
